title: Struggling John Lewis Partnership doubles down on personal finance to boost its coffers as sales dwindle
text:
John Lewis and Waitrose have redoubled efforts to build up a personal finance arm as losses and £2.4bn debts test the retail institution’s strength.

The employee-owned John Lewis Partnership has been ramping up marketing of loans, foreign currency and pet and wedding insurance in its department stores and supermarkets, as well as online, in recent weeks as it seeks new sources of income to ease the pressure on its own finances.

In May, it also signed a new deal with French insurance firm Covéa to offer overhaul its car insurance and make it more attractive.
